title: Lionel Messi and Andres Iniesta will both sign a new contracts at Barcelona, insists club director

Barcelona's sporting director has dismissed claims that Lionel Messi and Andres Iniesta are considering leaving the club. 
Both players' contracts expire in the summer of 2018. Negotiations have been ongoing for some time but with little visible progress. 
Robert Fernandez, however, insists there is no cause for concern and both players will extend. 
"[Messi] will renew, as I've always said," he told Spanish radio station Cadena Ser . "He is happy in Barcelona, he feels comfortable in the team and the environment is perfect. 
"I don't have any doubt [that he'll sign a new deal]. Looking into his eyes I see that he is happy at Barcelona. 
"I don't want to speak too much, though, as I know that there are many repercussions with this topic. 
"[Iniesta] will also renew and he'll do it in his own time. I have no doubt that he'll renew and neither does he." 
Various reports in Spain have suggested that if Messi does sign, it will be for a deal of around £35million-a-year, or £670,000-a-week. Like us on Facebook
